tweets.text: @chrisdaleoxford @EnvAgency It can hardly be said that the Government has had insufficient time to foresee this and produce the regulation in time for the harvest. Daffodils brighten all our lives and provide valuable income for the growers and everyone in the industry.

Daffodil companies need seasonal pickers. A new regulation is needed to allow this. 

The government won‚Äôt get around to this in time for this year‚Äôs season says George ‚ÄòUseless‚Äô Eustice at @EnvAgency (the Times) https://t.co/yddswjn5S3
@DorsetRachel @EnvAgency Eustice brought his own prejudices to the @Conservatives, who were so keen to mop up UKIP followers that they abandoned their business sense
@chrisdaleoxford @EnvAgency I saw daffodils in flower in Abbotsbury yesterday, just on the side of the road. How could George Eustice and his advisers be so unaware of the horticultural calendar?
We are supporting @WYFRS who are tackling this large fire in central Bradford - local residents please follow the advice to keep your doors & windows closed https://t.co/mM5qfqqNRL

tweets.text: Andy & Joe from the #Worcestershire field operations team back out this morning to open up the waterside gates at #Upton and  the #Uckinghall flood gate, New Street gate remains closed due to water still on the road and will be assessed again tomorrow @WorcsTravel @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/PsHKKo2ZmG
@DorsetRachel @EnvAgency Down west and in the Scilly Isles, yes - the earliness a big commercial advantage if you can get the workers.
@chrisdaleoxford @EnvAgency And no apology for being myopic and slow.
@chrisdaleoxford @EnvAgency Daffodils flower in early spring: who knew?

Fancy doing a fully funded @LivUni flowonthego PhD?

This will start in February with @GeomorphologyDr & @highamjonny 

Get in touch ASAP...

https://t.co/IyaNf5ZB5q

@livunigeog @fyfluiddynamics @floodinnovation @EnvAgency

tweets.text: Cracking day on River Mersey today https://t.co/sNFNNdvIjX

We are working with a number of partners to improve the condition of 8.6 miles of Alconbury Brook.

The improvements include leaky dams which will lower the flood risk downstream and adding woody material to provide refuge areas for fish and invertebrates. (1/2) #Cambridgeshire https://t.co/2l2v0MWSke

@EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @TonyJuniper @NaturalEngland @ForestryEngland @COP26 @DefraGovUK I'm not sure the Regime is listening.

Thousands asked them to cancel HS2 because its scarfing up the countryside, destroying ancient and rare habitats while adding to the climate crisis.

We continue to destroy biodiversity & habitats faster than we can recover.

#StopHS2 #COP26

tweets.text:
2020 has been a good year for beavers in England! The canals and dams beavers build alleviate flood risk and create wetlands for other species. 

400 years ago they were hunted to extinction, find out about the successes we've seen in their reintroduction: https://t.co/JSWh5o63Kd

urls.title: Why 2020 has been good for England's beavers
urls.description: Homes for these "ultimate environmental engineers" have been set up in enclosures across England.

tweets.text: Big Congratulations to Leda Cai @leda_cai who submitted her thesis this last week! Leda has looked into bioturbation and other, early restoration drivers within a recently restored salt marsh (at Fingringhoe) in Essex. @UniOfYork @EWTFingringhoe @EnvAgency @SWIS_UoY #saltmarsh https://t.co/uqR1hPCzwr
An update from @EnvAgencyAnglia on the oil spill at Marston Marshes https://t.co/PED0l0qYQk

tweets.text: I've seen numerous complaints about the @NewsNBC quarry site in Silverdale, but today this could be smelt over 4 miles away. How is the borough meant to attract both families and businesses to the local area with this quarry and the gas/sulphur smell across the town?
